basics.name: Tobias Pfeiffer
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a software engineer, deeply interested in agile methodologies, teaching, the Internet, object oriented programming and developing software systems in a team-oriented approach. I contribute to a variety of open source projects, engage in a multitude of community events and enjoy going to and speaking at conferences.

highlights: Taught 3 introductory level Ruby on Rails courses at the Humboldt-University Berlin
Prepared material for an advanced level Ruby on Rails course
Built a website to show screencasts in a HTML friendly way using HTML5 and popcorn.s

work.summary: Was selected as a student for Google Summer of Code by the JRuby organization. Worked on the Shoes 4 code base improving performance, enhancing functionality and refactoring the code base to achieve better readability and maintainability.
Working on a spree ecommerce appllication.
Various jobs at the working group for Internet Technologies at the Hasso-Plattner Institute including working as a corrector for the lectures „Internet and WWW Technologies“ and „Internet Security“.

volunteer.summary: The Ruby User Group Berlin is a monthly meetup of people interested in Ruby and related topics. Each meeting consists of 3 presentations and a couple of lightning talks. Currently the user group attracts between 80 and 120 attendees per meeting. My main responsibilities are organizing venues, contacting speakers and moderating the meetings as well as the mailing list.

Rails Girls Berlin helps to diversify the tech community. I help by coaching at workshops and hackdays, as well as often giving the introductory presentation. Moreover I co-host a weekly project group since March 2013 to help interested attendees to dig deeper into the topic.
highlights: Helped multiple attendees to grow into a junior developer position from absolute beginners
Created a well received and often reused introductory slide deck

volunteer.summary: Mentored two Rails Girls Summer of Code teams, as well as helping with the selection process the teams application.

I've been part of the Shoes community for a long time and since roughly September 2013 assume a maintainer like role for the Shoes 4 project. This means besides contributing code I watch over issues and review pull requests as well as taking care of releases etc.

volunteer.position: Student volunteer and Program Committe member
volunteer.summary: Over time I've helped with multiple conferences. This includes student volunteer organizer at XP2012, volunteer at Agile Dev Practices 2013, volunteer at Goto Berlin 2013 and volunteer at eurucamp 2014. Most recently I was part of the program committee and a track host for goto; Berlin 2014.
